events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the highway involving two vehicles with moderate damage.
After review of the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned to manage the claim and assist with further documentation and claim process communications.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that it was under evaluation.
The claims department requested detailed photos of the vehicle damage along with a police accident report for further investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents including photographs, police report, and repair estimates promptly for the claim.
The claims investigation team began analysis of the submitted documents and assessed liability and claim validity.
Investigation was completed confirming the incident details and verifying the extent of damage to the insured vehicle.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs and associated expenses related to the vehicle accident.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and clear communication during the claims process.
The claim was formally approved confirming coverage for the damages incurred during the auto accident.
The approved settlement amount was disbursed to the insuredâ€™s account to facilitate timely vehicle repairs.
The claim case was closed after confirming the payment was received and all procedural steps were completed satisfactorily.
The documentation and records related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
